channel.title: [PI] Need Npc Help
channel.description: How do i make it so people when they click a npc it says something then a yes or a no and for the yes it gives then a item?

item.title: [PI] Need Npc Help
item.dc:creator: @nikolaww3 nikolaww3
item.description:
@nikolaww3 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:4, topic:438536”][quote author=nikolaww3 link=topic=541245.msg3964777#msg3964777 date=1333593489]

That’s called dialogue my friend.

Actionhandler firstclicknpc send them a dialogue.
Dialoguehandler create several cases containing the desired dialogues. Clickingbuttons class will also be used since you’ll be creating dialogues with options.

addItem method within the playerassistant class to give them an item.

Thanks i think delta is sooo much easier to code!
[/quote]

That’s because instead of having packaging (if you can even consider PI as a packaged source) delta crams everything into the client class, which makes the server have to read and loop through everything, even when it’s not needed, on every tick (600ms) which creates a lot of unnecessary stress, aka lag. PI is handled poorly too, don’t get me wrong, but it’s a step-up imo.[/quote]Is there a tut on how to do this?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need Npc Help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“nikolaww3, post:3, topic:438536”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=541245.msg3964767#msg3964767 date=1333593145]
That’s called dialogue my friend.

Actionhandler firstclicknpc send them a dialogue.
Dialoguehandler create several cases containing the desired dialogues. Clickingbuttons class will also be used since you’ll be creating dialogues with options.

addItem method within the playerassistant class to give them an item.
[/quote]
Thanks i think delta is sooo much easier to code![/quote]

That’s because instead of having packaging (if you can even consider PI as a packaged source) delta crams everything into the client class, which makes the server have to read and loop through everything, even when it’s not needed, on every tick (600ms) which creates a lot of unnecessary stress, aka lag. PI is handled poorly too, don’t get me wrong, but it’s a step-up imo.

Read full topic
